ratings.comment: Shocked UW still employs her! Lacks professionalism, often distracted, once left a student teaching us to tend to 'urgent business,' only to work on personal tasks in the library. She plays favorites—if she likes you, you're set; if not, there's no changing her mind. Enroll with her at own risk. Worse still is choosing her as your PhD supervisor!
If you value your education, stay away from this person.

As a linguistics student, I should say I have never seen anyone like Miss Macken who is so passionate about her field of study. I should say I totally admire her. But one thing to be warned is that you need to read a lot of difficult text in order to get fully prepared and understand what she is saying. She talks very quietly so better sit at front

Professor Macken is a wonderful professor. She loves her discipline and she loves teaching. Homework assignments really help you learn, and her assessments of your work are really an assessment of how much effort you put in and how much you can show you have learned. Reading the book is absolutely necessary. If you are struggling she will help you!
She is nice, but it is very difficult to understand her. She talks very quietly and is all over the place. Her handwriting is illegible

Not a fan. I'm the kind of person who needs a class with structure, and this class didn't have it. I never really knew what was going on. Professor Macken was helpful one-on-one, but in the class setting, I was usually pretty confused. She is a lenient grader, which helped, but I did feel like I taught myself the bulk of the material from the text.

fantastic human being. grades really generously. shes so funny and forgetful. however the class made me realize i dont want to do linguistics. i find it sad that a cool person like marlys knows all this phonological stuff about s.e. asian languages but does not speak them..

Saying that Marlys is a bit eccentric would be an understatement. She's very knowledgeable about her topic and at times has times dumbing it down to a level that's intuitive for someone having problems following. She has a very "Eeyore" monotone affect, but is very enthusiastic about Phonology. Very dry sense of humor, which alienates some people.

Professor Macken can come off as a little spacey sometimes, but she's really in love with what she does and teaching it. She's a very nice lady, and is very willing to offer help if you need it.  Read the book - it's written terribly, but it helps tremendously.

She's really really excited about the subject and expects you to be too. Did homework in groups which was helpful but the text and lectures were beyond boring. Comes off as strict but grades very leniently. Attendance not mandatory but you will miss content that won't be covered again if you skip. 5 homeworks, 3 tests.

This woman is my hero.  If you love phonology, you will love her; if you hate phonology, you will hate her.  Personally, love both.  She is Dumbledore-style crazy brilliant and she is absolutely delightful to talk to outside of class.  She is a must-take prof for enthusiastic linguistics students :)

I can understand what about her teaching style would not mesh well with some students, but I personally find her to be a great professor.  Her study guides do provide a good indication of what will be on exams, and her ambition is certainly not to trick you.  She's extremely motherly, obviously engaged in her subject, and I'd take a class with her.
Marlys is great. She takes a different approach from most of the department in terms of theoretical footing. Which is refreshing. Great experience with her.
She left the ILC ILS course curriculum far too open--there was no structure to the course at all. Total waste of my time.
